en: Great success for Plzeň (Czech Republic) as European Capital of Culture 2015
The one-year programme has been a tremendous success so far and there are still several unique events in store before the end of the year.
Great success for Plzeň (Czech Republic) as European Capital of Culture 2015
58-Document for general distribution (intended for the general public)
The one-year programme has been a tremendous success so far and there are still several unique events in store before the end of the year.

The cultural programme of Plzeñ has attracted a large number of visitors since its launch in January.

From January to June, Plzeñ welcomed 599,000 visitors and organised 255 events - more than originally expected.

The Liberation Festival (the 70th anniversary of Plzeñ's liberation at the end of World War II) attracted an audience of 180,000 people.

Two exhibitions, Homo Urbanus Europeanus, a public exhibition of photographs by Jean Marc Caracci, and Gottfried Lindauer, the Pilsen painter of New Zealand Maoris, showcasing rare paintings of indigenous Maoris, attracted respectively 16,000 and 11,000 visitors.

A grand retrospective exhibition of works by Czech artist Jiří Trnka connected with an interactive exhibition for children brought in a massive 44,800 visitors - an unprecedented success!
 
The local economy has felt the benefits of Plzeñ's cultural blossoming. In Plzeñ, overnight stays increased by 34% compared to the first half of 2013, due to the massive presence of foreign tourists.

A boom in guided tours (a total of 430 from January to June) as well as the increasing number of visits in local museums and attractions has stimulated the cultural economy in the city.

Still want to experience Plzeñ this year?

You still have four months to discover the 2015 Capitals:

In September, the International Festival Theatre is taking place in Plzeñ. On Plzeñ's website, you can discover many more events and activities yet to unfold.

Cannot visit Plzeñ? You can join the community and be part of their 22,000 Facebook supporters and follow them on Twitter as one of their 2,800 followers.

Mons, Belgium, the other European Capital of Culture for 2015 also has a packed cultural agenda for the rest of the year and may be easier for you to visit.
